column4: there's always the chance that it will not work correctly with your system, and I don't think you can uninstall it with software center, though you *might* be able to with synaptic
how would I uninstall it manually then?
it's best to install things from s/w center or synaptic, if at all possible, if you're desparate, try a ppa, but if you're unsure what you're doing, it's best to avoid .debs
what is the software that you installed?
